abstract: Study published in The Archives of Internal Medicine finds older women who use common dietary supplements die at slightly higher rates than women who do not; study's lead author is Jaakko Mursu of University of Minnesota.
snippet: In a large study, older women who used common dietary supplements died at slightly higher rates than women who did not.
lead_paragraph: In a large study, older women who used common dietary supplements died at slightly higher rates than women who did not.

headline.main: Prevention: Doubts on Women’s Use of Supplements
headline.print_headline: Prevention: Doubts on Women’s Use of Supplements
headline.seo: Study Casts Doubts on Women’s Use of Dietary Supplements
